newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Daewoo Sec planning Cambodia bank j/v.
newsitem.headline: Daewoo Sec planning Cambodia bank j/v.

text.p: Daewoo Securities Co, a unit of South Korea's Daewoo Group, said on Friday it was planning a joint venture with a Cambodian businessman to set up a commercial bank in Phnom Penh.
The joint venture will be capitalised at about $10 million, and Daewoo plans to hold an 80 percent stake, a spokesman for the brokerage firm said.
The remainder will be invested by Cambodian businessman Huot Vanthan, the spokesman said.
Daewoo expects the joint venture to open in the first quarter of next year, although it must first get approval from the Seoul government, he added.
